snippet: The family limited partnership, an arcane way for affluent families to centralize the management of property, has suddenly become popular.
abstract: Paul Sullivan Wealth Matters column notes the rapid increase in the establishment of family limited partnerships, a once-esoteric way for wealthy families to centralize the management of real estate and other assets; contends that the wealthy are scrambling to incorporate due to the scheduled expiration of a $5.12 million gift tax exemption at the end of 2012.
lead_paragraph: The family limited partnership, an arcane way for affluent families to centralize the management of property, has suddenly become popular.

headline.seo: With Tax Breaks Set to Expire, Wealthy Families Are Turning to Partnerships
headline.main: In an Unusual Tax Year, the Wealthy Turn to Partnerships
headline.print_headline: In an Unusual Tax Year, the Wealthy Turn to Partnerships
